name: Avenue of Stars

images.alt: The entrance plaza of the Avenue of Stars with a large map display
Aerial view of Victoria Harbour and the promenade from an elevated vantage point
Walkway and viewing platform along the Avenue of Stars, lined with tourists
Palm trees and crowds at dusk on the Avenue of Stars overlooking the harbour
Nighttime skyline of Victoria Harbour seen from the Avenue of Stars

description: The Avenue of Stars runs along the Victoria Harbour waterfront and offers one of the best vantage points for capturing Hong Kong's skyline and nightly light show. Whether you visit in daylight or after dark, you'll experience stunning views of the city across the water.

name: Victoria Peak

images.alt: View of Victoria Peak tram station and surrounding plaza
Panoramic vista of Hong Kong Island and Victoria Harbour from the Peak
The Peak tram winding up the hillside past lush greenery

description: Victoria Peak offers the most sweeping views over Hong Kong Island and Victoria Harbour. A ride on the historic Peak Tram transports you up steep slopes to a spectacular vantage point—ideal for photographers and first-time visitors alike.

name: Central Harbourfront

images.alt: Central's heritage façades glowing in dusk light
Central's buildings and road in the evening.
Visitors posing in front of the 'I LOVE 852' sign beside the Ferris wheel

description: Central Harbourfront features the iconic Hong Kong Observation Wheel and a bustling promenade of shops and eateries. It's a perfect spot to snap panoramic city views by day or enjoy the wheel's colorful lights after sunset.
